Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: NEW KINGDOM (not after); MIDDLE KINGDOM (not before)
Name: Unguent jar
Description: Lovely little vase very carefully manufactured (the clay is fine, pure, well fired and red-orange). The base is flat, the body pear-shaped with a tall and narrow neck and with an unrestricted mouth and a small convex lip. It could have contained perfume or unguent. It was found in a dwelling.
